macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. stocks close at fresh record highs; futures edge lower ahead of key CPI
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose about 0.6–0.7% to a new all‑time high near 6,966, while the Dow Jones gained roughly 0.5% to a record above 49,500 and the Nasdaq Composite added about 0.8% on Friday, led by tech and housing-related names.[4][6] In early Monday trade, S&P 500 and Dow futures are down around 0.5% and Nasdaq futures about 0.8% as investors turn cautious ahead of Tuesday’s U.S. CPI release.[4]
items.source: Associated Press / WSLS; Emirates NBD Research

items.title: Global equities start week with mixed tone as Asia gains and China stabilizes
items.summary: Asian markets opened firmer, with Hong Kong’s Hang Seng and China’s Shanghai Composite each up about 0.4%, while previous-week data showed the Hang Seng briefly hit a two‑month high before pulling back to test support near 26,000.[1][4] Strategists note signs of stabilization in Chinese markets and policy support for financials, with Chinese insurers among the most actively traded on expectations of steady rates.[1]

items.title: Dollar strengthens on resilient U.S. jobs data as markets scale back near‑term Fed cut bets
items.summary: The U.S. dollar index (DXY) broke above its 50‑day moving average after Friday’s jobs report showed unemployment unexpectedly falling to 4.4% despite softer‑than‑expected payroll growth of 50,000, reinforcing expectations that the Fed will hold rates through Q1.[5] Two‑year Treasury yields climbed about 4 bps to 3.53% and markets now assign roughly a 30% probability to a Q1 Fed rate cut, focusing next on December CPI.[5]

items.title: Fed officials deliver mixed but generally cautious rhetoric ahead of inflation data
items.summary: Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic emphasized the need to keep fighting inflation over the weekend, while Richmond Fed’s Thomas Barkin highlighted subdued hiring and modest job growth, underscoring a cautious stance on near‑term easing.[5] Separately, New York Fed President John Williams is scheduled to speak Monday, with investors watching for any hints about the timing and extent of potential 2026 rate cuts.[3][5]
items.source: Standard Chartered Daily Navigator; Sergey Tereshkin

items.title: Legal threat to Fed Chair Powell adds a new political risk as markets watch reaction
items.summary: U.S. equity markets shrugged off news that Fed Chair Jerome Powell faces a legal investigation tied to political pressures, with major indices still closing at record highs.[4] However, the development has boosted demand for traditional safe‑haven assets such as gold and could elevate perceived policy risk if the situation escalates.[4]

items.title: Investor sentiment improves in U.S. as Michigan index hits four‑month high
items.summary: The preliminary University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for January rose to 54.0 from 52.9, the highest in four months, driven by a stronger current conditions component at 52.4.[6] Inflation expectations one year ahead remained anchored at 4.2%, a factor closely watched by the Fed as it gauges the persistence of price pressures.[6]

items.title: Indian inflation at record low and Japan trade data in focus as Asia sets tone
items.summary: Global investors are watching record‑low inflation data out of India and new trade figures from Japan, which are helping shape expectations for Asian growth and potential policy moves by regional central banks.[3] These releases, combined with stronger Chinese equity moves, form a key part of Monday’s macro backdrop for EM and FX markets.[1][3]

items.title: Canada labor market softens as unemployment climbs, pressuring CAD
items.summary: Canada’s unemployment rate rose to 6.8% in December, with the number of unemployed increasing at the fastest pace in three years despite a fourth straight month of employment growth.[5] The weaker labor backdrop and subdued oil prices pushed USD/CAD about 0.4% higher on Friday, with strategists maintaining a bullish view on the pair in the near term.[5]

items.title: Small caps and homebuilders lead U.S. equity gains as breadth improves
items.summary: Market breadth in the U.S. has improved, with the Russell 2000 small‑cap index posting its strongest start to a year since 2021, rising about 4.6% last week.[1] Homebuilders and related cyclicals rallied sharply, with names like Lennar, D.R. Horton, and PulteGroup up roughly 7–9%, while Builders FirstSource and utility/energy name Vistra were among the strongest individual S&P 500 performers.[1][4]

items.title: Earnings season set to begin with focus on Fed commentary and bond auctions
items.summary: The new U.S. earnings season kicks off this week with investors particularly sensitive to guidance on margins and demand against a backdrop of high but stable policy rates.[3] With a light macro calendar on Monday in the U.S. and Europe, markets are concentrating on Fed speakers, Treasury auctions, and early corporate results as they position ahead of the key CPI print.[3]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI insiders launch 'Poison Fountain' campaign to poison training data for large models
items.summary: A small group of anonymous AI industry insiders has launched the 'Poison Fountain' initiative, urging website operators to embed links that serve subtly corrupted code and content to AI web crawlers in an effort to poison future training data and highlight model vulnerabilities. The organizers, some reportedly working at major US AI firms, say the goal is to expose AI’s ‘Achilles’ heel’ and encourage active resistance to large-scale model deployment, though the scope and impact of the effort remain unclear.

items.title: ASIC-based AI inference servers forecast to grow four times faster than training servers
items.summary: Market Intelligence and Consulting Institute (MIC) forecasts that shipments of servers for AI inference will be about four times higher than those for AI training this year, with application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) expected to outpace GPU-based systems in shipment growth. While GPUs will continue to dominate the overall AI server market, MIC says ASICs are increasingly favored for inference because of their efficiency, lower power consumption, and suitability for fixed, cost-sensitive workloads, with Taiwanese manufacturers poised to expand into this segment.

items.title: GenAI boom drives datacenter server spending toward $100B per quarter
items.summary: Industry analysis based on IDC data suggests that, propelled by the generative AI boom, average quarterly server sales in 2025 will exceed $100 billion, with AI systems increasingly dominating datacenter infrastructure spending. The report highlights how hyperscalers, cloud builders, and large enterprises are rapidly expanding AI capacity, and notes IBM’s push to integrate its own AI stack and Spyre accelerators with Power Systems to capture growing inference workloads.

items.title: Packworks reports 46% sales boost for Philippine sari-sari stores using AI tools
items.summary: Tech startup Packworks.io reports that small neighborhood 'sari-sari' stores using its AI-driven precision marketing and inventory recommendation tools achieved a 46% increase in sales compared with non-AI users. The study finds that AI-enabled stores generated higher revenue even while operating on 20% fewer selling days, indicating that machine-learning insights on product mix, demand planning, and pricing can significantly improve microretail efficiency and profitability.

items.title: New Jersey accelerates AI–life sciences hub with major investments and Microsoft partnership
items.summary: New Jersey is expanding its position as a US hub for AI in life sciences through initiatives such as the NJ Artificial Intelligence Hub and HELIX NJ, alongside coordinated state-level AI leadership and training programs. The state has attracted Microsoft’s new Discovery platform—one of only two such sites globally—and a $20 million investment package from the NJ Economic Development Authority, CoreWeave, and others to support AI-focused health and biotech startups and shared compute infrastructure.

items.title: Opinion: With €520bn in AI spending this year, questions mount over path to AGI
items.summary: A new analysis estimates global AI investment at about €520 billion this year and examines whether scaling today’s machine learning and generative models can realistically lead to artificial general intelligence (AGI). The piece surveys arguments from leading researchers on the limits of current architectures, the risks of model collapse and data quality issues, and the need for new paradigms beyond brute-force scaling to achieve human-level general intelligence.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: BioWare’s Anthem goes permanently offline as servers shut down
items.summary: EA and BioWare are shutting down the servers for Anthem on January 12, 2026, making the online-only looter-shooter completely unplayable and effectively removing it from commercial access.

items.title: Analysis of Anthem’s failure as its servers close and game becomes unplayable
items.summary: With Anthem’s servers closing on January 12, 2026, MeriStation publishes a postmortem detailing technical issues with Frostbite 3, mismanagement, and unrealized live-service promises that led to the game’s demise.

items.title: Datamine hints at Nintendo platform support in Call of Duty HQ launcher
items.summary: Dataminers have found references to Nintendo platforms in the Call of Duty HQ launcher code, reinforcing reports that a mainline Call of Duty entry is in development for the rumored Switch 2 hardware.

items.title: Mario Tennis Fever gets new 5‑minute overview trailer detailing modes and roster
items.summary: Nintendo released a new overview trailer for Mario Tennis Fever showcasing new game modes, experiences, and its largest series roster to date with 38 playable characters, including first-time additions like Goomba, Nabbit, Piranha Plant, Baby Wario, and Baby Waluigi.

items.title: JDM: Japanese Drift Master dated for PlayStation 5 release in February
items.summary: Open-world street racing title JDM: Japanese Drift Master, already available on PC and Xbox Series, has been announced for PlayStation 5 with a confirmed launch date in February.

items.title: Psychological horror game The 18th Attic gets new trailer and release date
items.summary: Steelkrill Studio unveiled a new trailer for The 18th Attic, a psychological horror game inspired by Fatal Frame and Resident Evil, revealing fresh gameplay and confirming its launch for next month.

items.title: Murder-mystery adventure The Real Face of a VTuber launches this week on PC
items.summary: Courtroom-style mystery game The Real Face of a VTuber, developed by Lilien Games and published by WhisperGames, is set to release on PC via Steam on January 13, blending VTuber studio drama with Ace Attorney–inspired investigation and trials.

items.title: PC Gamer spotlights five under-the-radar new Steam releases
items.summary: PC Gamer highlights five recent indie releases on Steam—Oddcore, Vital Shell, Dungeon Antiqua 2, Dreadmyst, and Blood Money: Lethal Eden—drawing attention to smaller titles amid January’s lighter release slate.

items.title: Roundup of new console and PC releases for the week of January 12–18
items.summary: A weekly release guide lists new games launching across PlayStation, Xbox, Switch, and PC between January 12 and 18, including titles such as Big Hops, Nom Nom: Cozy Forest Café, Cassette Boy, and Animal.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
